Detailed Description

Uses heuristic rules to choose the next market to enter.

Author:

00035         lightHigh = new FuzzyLogic.IsHigh(30, 70);

Member Function Documentation

int edu.ou.asgbook.datamining.FuzzyCandidateMarket.isGoodCandidate ( double  population,
double  lightIntensity 
) 

00041                                                                         {
00042         // apply the basic rules
00043         FuzzyLogic.Fuzzy highlight = lightHigh.apply(lightIntensity);
00044         FuzzyLogic.Fuzzy popSparse = populationSparse.apply(population);
00045         FuzzyLogic.Fuzzy popHigh = populationHigh.apply(population);
00046 
00047         // if high light and moderate population density ...
00048         FuzzyLogic.Fuzzy popModerate = popSparse.not().and( popHigh.not() );    
00049         FuzzyLogic.Fuzzy result = popModerate.and(highlight);
00050         
00051         return (int) Math.round(result.getValue()*10);
00052     }

static void edu.ou.asgbook.datamining.FuzzyCandidateMarket.main ( String[]  args  )  throws Exception [static] 

00054                                                             {
00055         // create output directory
00056         File out = OutputDirectory.getDefault("fuzzy");
00057         
00058         // read input (crop to cover Spain)
00059         LatLonGrid lights = NightimeLights.read(NightimeLights.WORLD).crop(980, 4080, 220, 350);
00060         LatLonGrid pop    = GlobalPopulation.read(GlobalPopulation.WORLD).crop(980, 4080, 220, 350);
00061         
00062         // sanity check: are both grids correctly geolocated?
00063         System.out.println("Lights nwcorner: " + lights.getNwCorner());
00064         System.out.println("Population nwcorner: " + pop.getNwCorner());
00065         
00066         // apply fuzzy logic
00067         FuzzyCandidateMarket rules = new FuzzyCandidateMarket();
00068         LatLonGrid result = LatLonGrid.copyOf(lights);
00069         result.fill(0);
00070         result.setMissing(0);
00071         for (int i=0; i < result.getNumLat(); ++i){
00072             for (int j=0; j < result.getNumLon(); ++j){
00073                 result.setValue(i,j, rules.isGoodCandidate(pop.getValue(i,j), lights.getValue(i,j)));
00074             }
00075         }
00076         
00077         // write out as image, for viewing
00078         KmlWriter.write(lights, out, "fzlights", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00079         KmlWriter.write(pop, out, "fzpop", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00080         KmlWriter.write(result, out, "candidatepixels", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00081         
00082         // find cities from population data using watershed
00083         EnhancedWatershedSegmenter seg = new EnhancedWatershedSegmenter(10, 1, 130, 10, 5);
00084         LabelResult label = seg.label(pop);
00085         RegionProperty[] popProps = RegionProperty.compute(label, pop);
00086         RegionProperty[] lightProps = RegionProperty.compute(label, lights);
00087 
00088         List<LatLon> points = new ArrayList<LatLon>();
00089         List<String> names = new ArrayList<String>();
00090         int[] howgood = new int[popProps.length];
00091         for (int i=1; i < howgood.length; ++i){
00092             howgood[i] = rules.isGoodCandidate(popProps[i].getCval(), lightProps[i].getCval());
00093             if (howgood[i] > 5){
00094                 points.add( result.getLocation(popProps[i].getCx(), popProps[i].getCy()) );
00095                 names.add( " " + howgood[i]);
00096                 System.out.println( points.get(points.size()-1) + " " + howgood[i]);
00097             }
00098         }
00099         KmlWriter.write(points, names, out, "candidates");
00100         
00101         LatLonGrid candidateCities = LatLonGrid.copyOf(result);
00102         for (int i=0; i < candidateCities.getNumLat(); ++i){
00103             for (int j=0; j < candidateCities.getNumLon(); ++j){
00104                 int regno = label.label.getValue(i,j);
00105                 if (regno > 0){
00106                     candidateCities.setValue(i, j, howgood[regno]);
00107                 } else {
00108                     candidateCities.setValue(i, j, 0);
00109                 }
00110             }
00111         }
00112         KmlWriter.write(candidateCities, out, "candidateCities", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00113     }
